ETYMOLOGY: From Latin probatio, from probare 'to test, prove'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The release of an offender from detention, subject to a period of good behavior under supervision; also, the period during which such supervision takes place.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 罪犯获释后在一定时期内受监督考察的行为；缓刑期。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He was sentenced to two years' probation for the offense.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他因该罪行被判处两年缓刑。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A period of testing and supervision, especially of an employee, to determine suitability for a position or membership.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （雇员或新成员的）试用期，考察期。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: New employees are usually on probation for three months before their contract is confirmed.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 新员工通常有三个月的试用期，之后才能确认合同。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The period during which a novice is trained and tested before taking vows in a religious order.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （修道士在发誓前的）见习期，考察期。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The young monk spent a year in probation before becoming a full member of the order.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位年轻的僧侣在成为正式成员之前度过了一年的见习期。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The action of testing or proving something.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 检验，证明；考察（此用法较少见）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: His long service was a probation of his unwavering loyalty.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他漫长的服役是对其坚定忠诚的考验。

REGISTER: Formal or neutral, depending on the context (legal, employment, or general).
